detaileddescription.para: set the choosenCollectionTree back, to the old values, that are stored in the savedTree. set haveData back to false.
actions for save Button set savedChanges to true set dataChanged to false set haveData to false

add a TreeItem to the ChoosenObjectTree
node

memberdef.argsstring: (CheckBoxTreeItem< String > node, TreeItem< String > list, TreeItem< String > node2)
memberdef.name: addNodeChoosenCollectionTree

detaileddescription.para:
add a node to a TreeItem given in the param list from Collections
node
- node from the CheckBoxTree that trows the ActionListener
list
- in which Tree (without CeckBoxes) we want to add a node
node2
- a node(should be leaf) from the choosenCollectionTree

parameterdescription.para: one methode for adding and removing nodes from the choosenDataTrees. At first check if the node.getParent() is an all-node or a sgo-node. If it's an all-node, the node can only be in the objectTab, because only there are the nodes with the Titel "all .." .
- the node from the Tree that throws the actionlistener

simplesect.para: foundInconsitency - boolean to tell if the user wanted to save data from an object, that he/she delayed later from the grid

detaileddescription.para:
clear the choosenObjectTree call recAllLeafes function to search for the leaves in the choosenCollectionTree, and save them in the savedTreeCollection call recExpandTree function to expand each node of the tree
choosenCollectionTree

simplesect.para: haveData - boolean to check if a notification to save the changes is needed

detaileddescription.para: this is a getter - Method for the Controller. in some possibilities the JavaFx has not initialized and would throw an exception

the recAllLeaves in the GiveDataCollections, put all leafs into a list, we want here to put it into a new tree. also if it found the leaf, it should check if the path even exists in the checkboxtree Collection and set the isSelected to true.

remove nodes and the parents if necessary from the choosenObjectTree
node
- selected Node throws the action listener
objectTree
-

memberdef.argsstring: (CheckBoxTreeItem< String > node, TreeItem< String > list, TreeItem< String > node2)
memberdef.name: removeNodeChoosenCollectionTree

detaileddescription.para:
remove a node + parents if necessary from the choosenCollectionTree
node

set the objTree into the objectTree, and so the actionListener to the address of the tree
objTree

the methode looks which Tree is the mother of the selected node, to avoid activating CheckBoxes and creating choosenTrees twice
collectionTreeIsMother - is node a part of collectionTree

this method checks if the siblings of a parent are also isSelected(true); if yes, then it will set the all-node also isSelected(true); other way around for isSelected(false) also
node

when the user deleted one object, but has choosen paramaters from it, to save it during the simulation, its action creates an inconsistency we cant save anything, that isnt there anymore. the choosenTrees will always be new generated by each start of the frame. so we have to check if there are to many objects in the savedTree, than in the tree from the grid this function searchs rec for inconsistency
leaf
- from the savedTree
list
- the new generated choosenTree

memberdef.argsstring: (CheckBoxTreeItem< String > list, CheckBoxTreeItem< String > searchedNode, CheckBoxTreeItem< String > conditionNode)
memberdef.name: recSearch

detaileddescription.para:
recSearch search recursive for a spacific searchedNode in a transfered list (mostly the collectionTree or objectTree). Sometimes we want an extra conditionNode (like search all parameters where the parent of this node is a house)
list
- a checkBoxTreeItem node, through which the algorithm is searching for a specific node
searchedNode
- is the node we are searching. at the start, the selected node which throws the actionlistener
conditionNode
- extras we want, like that the parent is a specific node.

parameterdescription.para: - TreeItem the right trees from the tab on the right side from the resultswindow
- the node which activated the actionlistener expands the tree

detaileddescription.para:
Methode checks how the node is set (isSelected, isNotSelected), and than we set the other node also that way
node
- which throws the action listener
setNode
- node which we want be selected or unselected

simplesect.para: Sabrina Huber the actionListener for the checkBoxActions in the Tab. when a checkBox is selected or unselected, the actionlistener will add the node into the correct choosenTree it also clicks onto the equivalent object in the other tree. check if the number of objects on the grid, is the same number in our trees
